comments:
sometimes, in the Java editor I see the following behaviour:
- I can type text
- I can select with the mouse
- but Command-space, Command-C, Command-V don't work
- Copy and Paste via Menu works
- Command-V sometimes affects an editor that is behind the selected
- The Tab of the selected editor is dark grey, not blue, I can select another
editor tab, which comes in front and also has a dark greyed tab.

This behaviour happens frequently, but I don't know how to reproduce it.

It is new with 3.1M6 and/or Mac OS X 10.3.9. (I updated both at the same time).

I rebooted between instances of this behaviour.

Kim, you emphasized commands and keyBindings in the summary. Notice the symptom
that the tabs are grey and not blue. This is a hint that Eclipse is not aware of
the fact that it is the foreground application/owns the top window. Grey is the
color of windows that are in the background.

Gerd

I agree.  This is a problem with activation events not being sent.  Either this
is an SWT problem, or a problem with the part activation code (Stefan).
Were there any exceptions in your log? (If so, please attach them here)

Hmmmm, yes, but I'm not sure whether they belong to the development
workbench or to the plugin that I started from the workbench
in a different workspace. I had some problems (which are solved now) in the
Eclipse plugin that I'm writing. This can't be the cause of the effects, or can
it be? Is it possible that problems in a plugin that is launched from the
development  workbench can cause these effects in the development workbench?

Gerd

No, that's not possible. You'll find the log for the outer workbench in your
workspace's .metadata/.log file... or go to help->about->configuration
details->View Error Log

This is exactly what bug 73500 would look like in the UI, although I've never
been able to replicate outside test suites. It should happen if anyone calls
IWorkbenchPage.bringToTop for a part in the same stack as the active part.


*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 73500 ***

Here are the latest exceptions in my log, if you are still interested. Not sure,
which of them belong to this bug. 

The 'cvs version' log entry is not part of this bug, it is related to
http://www.xs4all.nl/~mjmeijer/cvsonmac.html

------------------------------------------------
